collection.name: source_CAT

variables.name: score
variables.description:
Score R list object with following elements:

  • score$theta
  • score$sem

variables.name: item_debug
variables.description: 1 to turn item debug mode on. 0 to turn it off. Item debug mode let's you specify which item you want to view from your item bank.

params.label: No answer alert
params.description: Alert message that will appear when no answer is given
params.name: no_answer_alert

params.label: Response width
params.description: Can be any valid CSS width property value. E.g.: 200px, 20%.
params.name: response_width

params.label: Randomize response options order
params.description: Check if you want order of response options to be random
params.name: randomize_response_options

params.label: Item bank
params.description:
CAT item bank definition.

Leave item response options list empty for open question.
params.name: item_bank

params.label: Next item randomesque
params.description: The number of items to be chosen from the next item selection rule, among those the next item to be administered will be randomly picked up. Default value is 1 and leads to usual selection of the optimal item for the specified criterion.
params.name: randomesque

params.label: Time-based stopping rule
params.description: Time-based stopping rule that will stop the test when specified amount of seconds will pass
params.name: stopping_time

params.label: Item count-based stopping rule
params.description: Item count-based stopping time that will stop the test after specified number of items is answered
params.name: stopping_item_count

params.label: Accuracy-based stopping rule
params.description: Accuracy-based stopping rule that will stop the test when at least certain accuracy is reached
params.name: stopping_accuracy

collection.name: CAT

variables.name: item_bank
variables.description:
CAT item bank definition.

Leave item response options list empty for open question.

variables.name: stopping_time
variables.description: Time-based stopping rule that will stop the test when specified amount of seconds will pass

variables.name: stopping_item_count
variables.description: Item count-based stopping time that will stop the test after specified number of items is answered

variables.name: stopping_accuracy
variables.description: Accuracy-based stopping rule that will stop the test when at least certain accuracy is reached

variables.name: randomesque
variables.description: The number of items to be chosen from the next item selection rule, among those the next item to be administered will be randomly picked up. Default value is 1 and leads to usual selection of the optimal item for the specified criterion.

variables.description: Check if you want order of response options to be random

variables.description: Can be any valid CSS width property value. E.g.: 200px, 20%.
